is a historic market town in
, England, near the A1 (or Great North Road) and the M62 motorway.

Historically it was a Borough in the West Riding of Yorkshire.  Since 1974 it has been one of the 'Five Towns' in North East of the Metropolitan District of the City of Wakefield and has a population of 28,250. Pontefract's motto is Post Mortem Patris Pro Filio, Latin for "After the death of the father, support the son", a reference to English Civil War Royalist sympathies.
